peopleAlsoAsk.question: What is the most valuable teapot?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: Designed by Mr Sethia in 2016, the Egoist teapot is officially certified by Guinness World Records as the world's most valuable teapot. It is entirely paved in 1,658 white diamonds and 386 rubies, with a central 6.67 carat ruby which once formed part of his late wife Chitra's jewellery collection.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: Teapot - Chitra Collection

peopleAlsoAsk.question: How do you tell the age of a teapot?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: **Patina**: Antique metal teapots, especially those made of silver or cast iron, develop a patina over time. This is a natural darkening or tarnishing of the metal's surface that adds depth and character. A well-developed patina is a good indicator of age.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: How can i tell if my teapot is antique? – TrueTeaLife

peopleAlsoAsk.question: How do you date a teapot?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: **Marks and Inscriptions**: Many antique teapots are marked or inscribed with information that can aid in dating them. These marks may include the name of the manufacturer, the date of production, or even a seal or signature of the artisan.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: How to date antique teapots? – TrueTeaLife
